recipe_name: Roasted garlic poussin with peppers and sauce vierge
author: Richard Phillips
method: Preheat the oven to 180C/350F/Gas 4. For the poussin, heat the olive oil in an ovenproof pan and add the poussin and garlic. Fry the poussin for 4-6 minutes, turning frequently, or until golden-brown all over. Season well with salt and freshly ground black pepper, then transfer to the oven to roast for 12-15 minutes, or until cooked through.  For the peppers, heat the olive oil in a frying pan and add the peppers and olives. Fry for 6-7 minutes, or until the peppers are tender.  For the sauce vierge, gently heat the oil, lemon juice and garlic in a small pan until warmed through. Remove from the heat and stir in the basil. To serve, place the poussin and peppers onto a serving dish and drizzle over the sauce vierge.
ingredients: 1 tbsp olive oil,  ½ poussin,  3 garlic cloves, skin-on and squashed,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  2 tbsp olive oil,  ½ red pepper, chopped,  25g/1oz Kalamata olives, stones removed,  6 tbsp olive oil,  2 tbsp lemon juice,  1 garlic clove, finely chopped,  6 fresh basil leaves, torn
